description: Customer API - .NET 10 Web API with CRUD operations for Customer entity using MySQL in Docker and Entity Framework Core

userStories.title: Project setup with .NET 10 and Docker MySQL
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a properly configured .NET 10 Web API project with Entity Framework Core and MySQL running in Docker so that I have a foundation to build upon.
acceptanceCriteria: Create new .NET 10 Web API project
Add Entity Framework Core packages for MySQL (Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql)
Configure DbContext with MySQL connection string from environment variables
Add docker-compose.yml with MySQL 8.0 container exposing port 3306
Add .env.example with required environment variables (MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD, MYSQL_DATABASE, ConnectionStrings__DefaultConnection)
Code builds successfully
Application starts without errors when MySQL container is running

userStories.title: Create Customer entity and initial migration
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the Customer entity defined with proper database mapping so that customer data can be persisted.
acceptanceCriteria: Create Customer entity with fields: Id (GUID, auto-generated), Name (required, max 100 chars), Email (required, max 255 chars), Phone (optional, max 20 chars), Address (optional, max 500 chars), CreatedAt (UTC datetime), UpdatedAt (UTC datetime)
Configure entity with Fluent API or data annotations for constraints
Create initial EF Core migration
Migration applies successfully to MySQL database
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Create Customer DTOs and AutoMapper configuration
userStories.description: As a developer, I need DTOs to separate API contracts from entity models so that the API has clean request/response models.
acceptanceCriteria: Create CreateCustomerDto with fields: Name (required), Email (required, email format validation), Phone (optional), Address (optional)
Create UpdateCustomerDto with same fields as CreateCustomerDto
Create CustomerResponseDto with all Customer fields including Id, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt
Configure AutoMapper profiles for entity-to-DTO mapping
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Implement POST create customer endpoint
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to create a new customer so that I can add customers to the system.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /api/customers endpoint accepts CreateCustomerDto in request body
Returns 201 Created with Location header and created customer (including generated Id and timestamps)
Returns 400 Bad Request for invalid data with validation error details
Email field is validated for proper email format
CreatedAt and UpdatedAt are automatically set to current UTC time
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Implement GET customer by ID endpoint
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to retrieve a specific customer by ID so that I can view their details.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/customers/{id} endpoint returns customer by GUID ID
Returns 200 OK with CustomerResponseDto when found
Returns 404 Not Found with error message when customer doesn't exist
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Implement GET customers list with pagination
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to retrieve a paginated list of customers so that I can browse customers efficiently.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/customers endpoint returns paginated customer list
Supports query parameters: page (default 1), pageSize (default 10, max 100)
Response includes: items array, totalCount, page, pageSize, totalPages
Returns empty items array (not 404) when no customers exist
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Add filtering and search to customers list
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to filter and search customers so that I can find specific customers quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/customers supports query parameter: search (searches Name and Email, case-insensitive)
GET /api/customers supports query parameter: email (exact match filter)
Filters are combined with AND logic when multiple provided
Filtering works correctly with pagination (totalCount reflects filtered results)
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Add sorting to customers list
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to sort the customer list so that I can view customers in my preferred order.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /api/customers supports query parameter: sortBy (name, email, createdAt)
GET /api/customers supports query parameter: sortOrder (asc, desc, default asc)
Default sort is by CreatedAt descending (newest first)
Sorting works correctly with pagination and filtering
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Implement PUT update customer endpoint
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to update an existing customer so that I can modify customer information.
acceptanceCriteria: PUT /api/customers/{id} endpoint accepts UpdateCustomerDto in request body
Returns 200 OK with updated CustomerResponseDto
Returns 404 Not Found when customer doesn't exist
Returns 400 Bad Request for invalid data with validation error details
UpdatedAt is automatically set to current UTC time on update
CreatedAt is not modified on update
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Implement DELETE customer endpoint
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want to delete a customer so that I can remove customers from the system.
acceptanceCriteria: DELETE /api/customers/{id} endpoint deletes customer by GUID ID
Returns 204 No Content on successful deletion
Returns 404 Not Found when customer doesn't exist
Customer is permanently removed from database (hard delete)
Code builds successfully
Tests pass with greater than 80% code coverage

userStories.title: Configure Swagger API documentation
userStories.description: As an API consumer, I want interactive API documentation so that I can explore and test the API easily.
acceptanceCriteria: Swagger/OpenAPI is configured and accessible at /swagger in development
All endpoints are documented with descriptions and response types
Request/response models are documented with XML comments
Swagger UI allows testing endpoints directly
Code builds successfully
